website_summaries.verdict: A highly effective unit that removes smoke and fumes on the workbench and in some other applications, too.
pros: Can remove soldering smoke and also fumes from other activities, like nail paint
cons: It's pricier than some other options, but you're paying for better reliability and service

customer_reviews.title: Works like it’s intended
customer_reviews.text: It’s what i expected, I use it for soldering and for help control the weed smell in the garage. It’s not going to create a huge suction, one has to be a few inches from it. But I expected that. It’s louder than I expected, but silence costs a lot more. Also, buy rolls of the carbon filter and cut it yourself. The precut prices are absurd.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Burke

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This fan did everything I expected to it to do. Works great in the kitchen when I am not trying to burn dinner...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cigars!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to set on my desk at home to deal with cigar smoke. So far doing a great job. As stated in Q&A, works best while cigar is being smoked. Don't count on it for clearing a cloud of smoke from the room.

customer_reviews.title: Smoke Absorber

I position it right across from Me so the fumes and smoke get sucked right into it and not into me! After a while I don’t even hear the fan. Comes with two extra filters.

customer_reviews.author: Historical Restorations Foundation

customer_reviews.title: Very usefully to eliminate smoke and paint odors.
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my bedroom to eliminate paint odor and when I smoked up the kitchen. Gets rid of odors fast.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Great fume extractor for soldering
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of soldering and I've been wanting one of these for a long time. I wanted something that will actually take the smoke away but not be too loud. This fits the bill. I made a video so you can see the smoke extraction. The fan sounds much louder in the video than it is in real life. It is actually very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: The Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Don't breathe fumes, that stuff is, literally, toxic. I recognized this design from working at an electronics company, so I was thrilled to have a chance to review it. The thing works as advertised, comes with several filters, and realistically makes the least amount of noise a fan can. The most important thing it does is draw the fumes from away from going straight up into your face. I can't believe the charcoal filters can remove all of the smoke, but the air does come out the other end transparent. Couldn't be happier :)
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Goodchild

customer_reviews.title: One of the best solder smoke absorbers I've used
customer_reviews.text: I felt like this was a bit expensive, and it may be, but it definitely does its job. With the solder smoke absorbers I've used in the past, I had to be immediately next to them to get any effect, but this works at a few inches away with no problem, and even grabbed smoke up to a foot away. I can't say for sure whether this is the best value, but it exceeded my expectations, and it'll definitely get the job done. If you need a solid solder absorber and are okay with spending a bit for what is just an activated carbon filter and a fan, this'll work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Valtcan Solder Smoke Absorber Fume Extractor
customer_reviews.text: I think the name is a bit misleading. In my opinion, the unit does not "absorb" fumes, but rather draws them away from the work area. There is a foam type filter, but I'm suspect it really does any filtering. The unit is well made and easily positionable. There is sufficient air flow to create a suction effect that will draw soldering fumes away from the work area and blow them out the back. I suspect a small fan blowing across the work area would work just as well at a considerable price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Need to be close
customer_reviews.text: I use this when soldering to pull the fumes away from my face -- you need to have it pretty close to make sure it's pulling them away. Fan isn't too loud -- and it's easy to position without being top heavy. Comes with a few extra carbon filters, replacements are expensive, but can cut your own out of bulk sheets/rolls.
customer_reviews.author: MrE

customer_reviews.title: very cool
customer_reviews.text: I like this fan... it does remove smoke very well... as it has a carbon filter on it.. However, I wish it offered different filters so you can remove other odors that are bad for health, such as certain glues.... maybe soon... great item, stop breathing things that are harmful !!! well built, rock solid...
customer_reviews.author: funbear

customer_reviews.title: Works but you can do better
customer_reviews.text: I find either of my hepa filter with carbon pre filter fans in my room work twice as good at removing smoke and odor in my room
customer_reviews.author: TRUE ARTIST

customer_reviews.title: Not for real smokers
customer_reviews.text: This Valtcan Solder Smoke Absorber is not worth the $68.99 price tag (price at the time of review). It's not for real smokers, even with it right next to you. It may help with fumes from crafts, but it's just not big enough to absorb smoke. It's of decent quality, just can't handle smoke from real smokers.
customer_reviews.author: JMM31

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Suction
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well-made and has very good suction (it will pull in smoke from a few surrounding feet). It's a bit noisy, but it's effective. Decent price, too.

product_meta.title: Valtcan Solder Smoke Absorber Fume Extractor Fan
feature_bullets: Remove Smoke, soldering fumes, flux smoke, odor from soldering stations, workstations, nails, paint etc quick,safe and efficiently

496 model equivalent to the 493 plus extra filters. Comes with 3 Active carbon filters, Easily replaceable by swamping out old for new one in filter slot. Pull filter guard out to remove filter and replace with new one. Then push back filter guard to hold filter in place.

Adjustable tilt for more direct smoke absorption from your workbench. Twist knobs at two ends to loosen and then adjust tilt of smoke absorber. Fasten knobs to secure fan front when desired tilt is obtained.
Made of ESD safe material, lightweight and durable material. Low noise and high- efficient fan operates at acceptable db levels in solder workstations.
On/off button located in back of smoke absorber fan. Plugs into AC socket for power. Comes in 493 model box with extra filters.
